info.title: Altitrace API
info.description: REST API for the Altitrace API

post.description: Simulate a single transaction with comprehensive analysis
Simulate a batch of independent transactions with comprehensive analysis

get.summary: Check the health of the API
get.description: Check the health of the API

AccessListEntry.description:
Access list entry for gas optimization.

Access lists (EIP-2930) pre-declare storage slots and addresses
that will be accessed, reducing gas costs for those operations.

address.description: Contract address that will be accessed.

storageKeys.description: Storage slots that will be accessed at this address.

ApiError.description: Detailed error information for failed requests.

code.description: Machine-readable error code for programmatic handling.

suggestion.description: Suggested resolution or workaround for the error.

trace.description: Stack trace for debugging (only in debug builds).

ApiResponse_HealthStatus.description:
Standard API response wrapper for all simulation endpoints.

This provides a consistent response format across the API,
including success/failure indication, data payload, error information,
and request metadata for tracking and debugging.

oneOf.description: Error information (present only on failed requests).

success.description: Indicates whether the request was processed successfully.

ApiResponse_SimulationResult.description:
Standard API response wrapper for all simulation endpoints.

This provides a consistent response format across the API,
including success/failure indication, data payload, error information,
and request metadata for tracking and debugging.

data.description:
Complete simulation result containing all execution details.

This is the main response structure for transaction simulation,
containing execution status, gas usage, logs, traces, and any errors.

accessList.description: Generated access list for gas optimization.

blockGasUsed.description: Total gas used in the simulated block.

blockNumber.description: The final block number after simulation (higher than input if new blocks created).

calls.description: Results for each transaction call in the simulation.

gasUsed.description: Total gas consumed by all calls.

oneOf.description: Error information (present only on failed requests).

success.description: Indicates whether the request was processed successfully.

ApiResponse_String.description:
Standard API response wrapper for all simulation endpoints.

This provides a consistent response format across the API,
including success/failure indication, data payload, error information,
and request metadata for tracking and debugging.

oneOf.description: Error information (present only on failed requests).

success.description: Indicates whether the request was processed successfully.

ApiResponse_Vec_SimulationResult.description:
Standard API response wrapper for all simulation endpoints.

This provides a consistent response format across the API,
including success/failure indication, data payload, error information,
and request metadata for tracking and debugging.

items.description:
Complete simulation result containing all execution details.

This is the main response structure for transaction simulation,
containing execution status, gas usage, logs, traces, and any errors.

accessList.description: Generated access list for gas optimization.

blockGasUsed.description: Total gas used in the simulated block.

blockNumber.description: The final block number after simulation (higher than input if new blocks created).

calls.description: Results for each transaction call in the simulation.

gasUsed.description: Total gas consumed by all calls.

oneOf.description: Error information (present only on failed requests).

success.description: Indicates whether the request was processed successfully.

diff.description:
Net change (post - pre, hex encoded).
Positive means gained, negative means lost.

post.description: Balance after simulation (hex encoded, smallest unit).

pre.description: Balance before simulation (hex encoded, smallest unit).

BlockOverrides.description:
Block environment overrides for simulation.

These overrides allow modifying the block context in which the simulation runs,
including block number, timestamp, gas parameters, and more.

baseFee.description: Override the base fee per gas (EIP-1559).

blockHash.description:
Custom block hash mappings for the BLOCKHASH opcode.
Maps block numbers to their corresponding block hashes.

number.description:
Override the block number.
For `eth_simulateV1`, this will be the first simulated block number.
Note: Different clients use different field names (geth: "number", erigon: "blockNumber").

random.description:
Override the prevRandao value (post-merge).
This replaces the difficulty field in post-merge chains.

time.description:
Override the block timestamp (Unix timestamp in seconds).
Note: Different clients use different field names (geth: "time", erigon: "timestamp").

BlockTag.description: Block tag options for specifying block context.

CallError.description: Detailed error information for failed or reverted calls.

contractAddress.description: Contract address where the error occurred.

CallResult.description: Result of a single transaction call within the simulation.

callIndex.description: Index of this call within the simulation.

oneOf.description: Error details (present if call failed or reverted).

logs.description: Event logs emitted by this call.

returnData.description: Data returned by the call (hex encoded).

status.description: Execution status of this specific call.

DecodedEvent.description: Human-readable event information decoded from log data.

params.description: Decoded event parameters with names and formatted values.

DecodedEventParam.description: Individual parameter from a decoded event.

indexed.description: Whether this parameter was indexed in the event.

EnhancedLog.description: Event log with optional decoded information for better readability.

address.description: Contract address that emitted this log.

blockHash.description: Block hash containing this log (null for simulations).

removed.description: Whether this log was removed due to chain reorganization.

transactionHash.description: Transaction hash that created this log (null for simulations).

transactionIndex.description: Transaction index within the block (null for simulations).

GasBreakdown.description:
Granular breakdown of gas usage by operation type.

This provides detailed insights into where gas is being consumed,
enabling developers to optimize their contracts and transactions.

calls.description: Gas used for external contract calls.

intrinsic.description: Intrinsic transaction cost (21,000 gas base cost).

logs.description: Gas used for emitting event logs.

refund.description: Gas refunded due to storage cleanup or other refunds.

PerformanceMetrics.description: Performance metrics for gas profiling and optimization analysis.

oneOf.description: Detailed gas usage breakdown by operation type.

stateReads.description: Number of storage read operations performed.

stateWrites.description: Number of storage write operations performed.

ResponseMetadata.description: Metadata included with every API response.

requestId.description: Unique identifier for request tracking and correlation.

timestamp.description: UTC timestamp when the response was generated.

SimulationOptions.description: Optional parameters for simulation behavior and output.

oneOf.description:
Block environment overrides.
Allows modifying block parameters like timestamp, number, etc.

stateOverrides.description:
State overrides to apply during simulation.
Allows modifying account states before execution.

oneOf.description: Trace configuration for detailed execution analysis.

SimulationParams.description: Core simulation parameters including transaction calls and context.

account.description:
Optional account address for tracking asset changes.
Required when `traceAssetChanges` or `traceTransfers` is enabled.

blockNumber.description:
Block number to simulate against (hex encoded).
This will be the PARENT block for the simulation.

oneOf.description:
Block tag to use as the parent for simulation.
Mutually exclusive with `block_number`.

calls.description:
Array of transaction calls to simulate.
Each call represents a transaction that will be executed in the simulation.

traceAssetChanges.description:
Enable tracking of ERC-20/ERC-721 token balance changes.
Requires `account` parameter to be set.

traceTransfers.description:
Enable tracking of ETH transfers as ERC-20-like logs.
ETH transfers will appear with address 0xeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeee.
Requires `account` parameter to be set.

validation.description:
Enable or disable EVM validation during simulation.
When false, behaves like `eth_call` with relaxed validation.

SimulationRequest.description:
Represents a complete simulation request for transaction execution.

This structure encapsulates all parameters needed to simulate a transaction
on the `HyperEVM` network, including the transaction details, block context,
simulation options, and any state or block overrides.

SimulationResult.description:
Complete simulation result containing all execution details.

This is the main response structure for transaction simulation,
containing execution status, gas usage, logs, traces, and any errors.

accessList.description: Generated access list for gas optimization.

blockGasUsed.description: Total gas used in the simulated block.

blockNumber.description: The final block number after simulation (higher than input if new blocks created).

calls.description: Results for each transaction call in the simulation.

gasUsed.description: Total gas consumed by all calls.

SimulationStatus.description: Execution status for the overall simulation.

StateOverride.description:
State override for a specific account address.

This allows modifying the state of an account before simulation,
including balance, nonce, code, and storage slots.

balance.description: Override the account's balance (hex encoded wei).

code.description:
Override the account's code (hex encoded bytecode).
For EOAs, use "0x" to set empty code.

movePrecompileToAddress.description:
Move a precompiled contract to this address.
This is an advanced feature for testing precompile behavior.

state.description:
Completely replace the account's storage.
All existing storage will be cleared and replaced with these values.
Cannot be used together with `state_diff`.

stateDiff.description:
Partially modify the account's storage.
Only specified slots will be changed, others remain unchanged.
Cannot be used together with `state`.

reads.description: Gas used for storage read operations (SLOAD).

writes.description: Gas used for storage write operations (SSTORE).

slot.description: The storage slot key (32 bytes, hex encoded).

value.description: The storage slot value (32 bytes, hex encoded).

enableReturnData.description: Enable return data capture in traces.

TracerType.description: Available tracer types for execution analysis.

TransactionCall.description: Represents a single transaction call within a simulation.

data.description:
The transaction data (calldata).
For simple ETH transfers, this can be empty or "0x".

from.description:
The sender address of the transaction.
If not specified, the zero address will be used.

gas.description:
Gas limit for the transaction (hex encoded).
If not specified, it will be estimated automatically.

to.description:
The recipient address of the transaction.
For contract creation, this should be None/null.

value.description: The value to send with the transaction in wei (hex encoded).

tags.name: health
tags.description: Health endpoints for checking the health of the API
